intro: Fridericia dispar, commonly known as the slender fridericia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Fridericia dispar is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
